labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to integrate with Asana, a popular project management platform. Its core functionality revolves around task and project management, allowing users to perform a wide range of operations such as creating, updating, searching, and managing tasks and projects directly from an AI/LLM interface. The server simplifies workflow automation by enabling seamless interaction with Asana's ecosystem, including handling dependencies, comments, tags, and project statuses.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Project Management" (custom) is chosen because the server's functionality is centered around managing tasks, projects, and workflows in Asana. The secondary label "Daily Productivity" is added as the tasks revolve around enhancing workflow and collaboration, key aspects of daily productivity. The third secondary label is "API Integration" since the server provides an interface to interact with Asana's API.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Asana Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @cristip73/mcp-server-asana
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect your AI tools to Asana seamlessly. Manage tasks, projects, and workspaces directly from your LLM interface, enhancing productivity and collaboration. Simplify your workflow by leveraging the power of Asana through intuitive commands and queries.

tools.name: asana_list_workspaces
tools.description: Deploy Server Asana Integration Server @cristip73/mcp-server-asana Try in Playground asana_list_workspaces

tools.name: asana_search_projects
tools.description: Search for projects in Asana using name pattern matching

tools.name: asana_search_tasks
tools.description: Search tasks in a workspace with advanced filtering options

tools.name: asana_get_task
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific task

tools.name: asana_create_task
tools.description: Create a new task in a project

tools.name: asana_get_task_stories
tools.description: Get comments and stories for a specific task

tools.name: asana_update_task
tools.description: Update an existing task's details

tools.name: asana_get_project
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific project

tools.name: asana_get_project_task_counts
tools.description: Get the number of tasks in a project

tools.name: asana_get_project_sections
tools.description: Get sections in a project

tools.name: asana_create_task_story
tools.description: Create a comment or story on a task

tools.name: asana_add_task_dependencies
tools.description: Set dependencies for a task

tools.name: asana_add_task_dependents
tools.description: Set dependents for a task (tasks that depend on this task)

tools.name: asana_create_subtask
tools.description: Create a new subtask for an existing task

tools.name: asana_get_multiple_tasks_by_gid
tools.description: Get detailed information about multiple tasks by their GIDs (maximum 25 tasks)

tools.name: asana_get_project_status
tools.description: Get a project status update

tools.name: asana_get_project_statuses
tools.description: Get all status updates for a project

tools.name: asana_create_project_status
tools.description: Create a new status update for a project

tools.name: asana_delete_project_status
tools.description: Delete a project status update

tools.name: asana_set_parent_for_task
tools.description: Set the parent of a task and position the subtask within the other subtasks of that parent

tools.name: asana_get_tasks_for_tag
tools.description: Get tasks for a specific tag

tools.name: asana_get_tags_for_workspace
tools.description: Get tags in a workspace

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@cristip73/mcp-server-asana/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
